Hrvatica brutalno o slovenskih politikih, tako jih ni smešil še nihče
Hrvaška provokacija ali nastavljeno ogledalo?
07 Nov 2019, 20:25 by T. V.



Slovenski premier Marjan Šarec in njegov hrvaški kolega Andrej Plenković. FOTO: Reuters



Politiki Slovencev in Hrvatov ne bodo sprli, piše. FOTO: Roman Šipić, Delo


ZAGREB – Čeprav so slovenski politiki naredili vse, kar so lahko, da bi prepričali Evropsko komisijo, da Hrvaška ni pripravljena za vstop v schengen, je komisija ugotovila, da Hrvaška izpolnjuje tehnične pogoje in tako je Slovenija utrpela nov mednarodni poraz, v članku z naslovom Bo kdaj konec strupene poplave? v Jutarnjem listu piše Mirjana Kasapović. Slovenski politiki so trdili, da Hrvaška tehničnih pogojev ne izpolnjuje, ker slabo varuje mejo z BiH pred nezakonitimi migranti in ne spoštuje vladavine prava, kar je pokazalo hrvaško nesprejemanje odločitve arbitražnega sodišča o meji. »Vse to trdijo politiki države, ki ima najslabšo vojsko v EU, morda tudi v Evropi, ki stalno pada na osnovnih Natovih testih bojne pripravljenosti. Vse to se trdi v državi, kjer nastajajo lokalne paramilice, nekakšne štajerske varde in vaške straže, ki prevzemajo policiji delo varovanja meje in ljudi. Vse to se trdi v državi, ki ima skrajno problematično obveščevalno službo, ki – kadar ne stavka – proizvaja različne škandale, od pošiljanja vohunskega kombija v Hrvaško do netransparentnega zaposlovanja prijateljice predsednika vlade. Vse to se trdi v državi, ki se pred nezakonitimi migranti varuje z bodečo žico na meji s Hrvaško,« je ostra avtorica članka. Dodaja, da je odnos pristopa Hrvaški k schengenu samo nova epizoda v stalni protihrvaški politični in medijski propagandi. »No, kmalu prihaja nov razlog za protihrvaško kampanjo: odločitev Evropskega sodišča o slovenski tožbi proti Hrvaški.« Spomnimo: Slovenija toži Hrvaško, ker ne spoštuje arbitražne sodbe.


Politiki Slovencev in Hrvatov ne bodo sprli, piše. FOTO: Roman Šipić, Delo

 »Glavna težava slovenske politike je, ker vzroke za svojo mednarodno neprepoznavnost in neuspešnost išče v drugih, a ne pri sebi,« piše komentatorka, nato pa doda, da je v zadnjem desetletju slovenska politika dobila skrajno neobičajne lastnosti, in našteje, kaj se je dogajalo od volitev 2011, ko so kot premierji zvrstili Alenka Bratušek, Miro Cerar in Marjan Šarec. Dejan Židan, »poražen v mednarodni bitki za teran, pa je postal predsednik državnega zbora. Prava galerija političnih poražencev,« je ostra. Neprizanesljiva je tudi do Šarca, za katerega piše, da medtem ko na domačem parketu še nekako pleše, »v tujini deluje kot izgubljen človek. Kamere ga običajno posnamejo, kako sam tava po bruseljskih hodnikih.« Avtorica zaključi, da kljub takim slovenskim politikom ne morejo toliko spreti Slovencev in Hrvatov, da bi se začeli množično sovražiti in vojskovati.

The Croatian is brutal about Slovenian policies, so no one has ridiculed them
Croatian provocation or set mirror?
07 Nov 2019, 20:25 by T.V.



Slovenian Prime Minister Marjan Sarc and his Croatian counterpart Andrej Plenkovic. PHOTO: Reuters



Politicians of Slovenes and Croats will not stop, he writes. PHOTO: Roman Sipic, Delo


ZAGREB - Although Slovenian politicians have done everything they can to convince the European Commission that Croatia is not ready to join Schengen, the commission found that Croatia meets the technical conditions and thus Slovenia suffered another international defeat, in an article entitled Will there ever be a toxic flood? Mirjana Kasapovic writes in Jutarnji List. Slovenian politicians have argued that Croatia does not meet the technical requirements because it poorly protects the border with BiH against illegal migrants and does not respect the rule of law, as indicated by Croatia's rejection of the arbitration tribunal's decision on the border. "All this is claimed by the politicians of the country with the worst military in the EU, perhaps also in Europe, which is constantly falling behind NATO's basic combat readiness tests. All this is being claimed in a country where local paramilitaries, some Styrian vards and village guards are emerging, who take over the work of protecting the border and the people. All this is being claimed in a country that has an extremely problematic intelligence service, which - when not on strike - produces various scandals, from sending a spy van to Croatia to the opaque recruitment of a Prime Minister friend. All this is being claimed in a country that protects itself against illegal migrants by barbed wire at the border with Croatia, "the author wrote. He adds that Croatia's attitude towards Schengen is only a new episode in the ongoing anti-Croatian political and media propaganda. "Well, a new reason for the anti-Croatian campaign is coming soon: the decision of the European Court of Justice on a Slovenian lawsuit against Croatia." Remember: Slovenia is suing Croatia for not respecting the arbitral award.


Politicians of Slovenes and Croats will not stop, he writes. PHOTO: Roman Sipic, Delo

"The main problem of Slovenian politics is that it is seeking reasons for its international recognition and failure in others, but not in itself," writes the commentator, adding that in the last decade Slovene politics has acquired extremely unusual characteristics, and lists what has become has been going on since the 2011 elections, when Alenka Bratusek, Miro Cerar and Marjan Sarac were prime ministers. Dejan Židan, “defeated in the international battle of Teran, became the President of the National Assembly. It's a real gallery of political losers, "she said harshly. She is also unreliable with Sarac, who writes that while on the domestic parquet she still dances, “she acts as a lost man abroad. Cameras usually record him wandering the Brussels corridors alone. ”The author concludes that, despite such Slovenian politicians, Slovenes and Croats cannot stand up to so much that they begin to hate and fight en masse.
